text: The support solution should be accessible to the users both from within the application and also outside the application through a browser interface.
Once the audit trail functionality has been activated, the System must track events without manual intervention, and store in the audit trail information about them.
The system should provide for role-based control for the functionality within the system.
The System should allow a user to stipulate which other users or groups can access cases.
If a user performs a quick or advanced search, the System must never include in the search result list any record which the user does not have the right to access.
Customer: A customer is an individual wishing to purchase inventory from GAMMA-J’s Web Store.
When creating a new account on Web Store it will default as a customer account.
Customers will be able to create accounts to store their customer profiles, configure contact information, view their purchase history, and confirm orders.

Products will be stored in multi-tiered categories; a category can contain sub categories or products. The inventory management will allow for administrators to update the categories, the products placed in categories, and the specific product details.
Customers will be able to add and store products for purchase within the shopping cart.
Inventory administrators can be affected to any administrative or organizational level according to their assigned tasks
Faculty administrator have control on his faculty inventory
University administrator and IT Administrators have the control on the entire inventory
IT group members can create a new space and modify floor structure when they receive an exception request from any administrative level
It is mandatory that learning time is between 2 to 4 hours at maximum, because many task are delegated to working students.
Any user who creates or joins a game will be able to upload their own JPEG or GIF image that they wish to have displayed above their name, if they do not wish to use a preset icon.
Users who create a new game will be able to choose to play different variations of Mahjong rules other than those described.
The MultiMahjongClient will inform the user whose turn it is to pick up a tile.
If a user leaves the game prematurely, a new CO is created on another user's machine to fill their place.

The software will provide the UAV operator the necessary tools for computer related communications, mission tasking, mission planning, mission execution, data receipt, data processing, limited data exploitation, and data dissemination.

The GUI shall allow the user to create, modify, copy, or delete applications or files regardless of the current status of HATS-SML.
The HATS-GUI shall suggest a file name for the user whenever it prompts the user to enter a file name.
The user shall be able to resize windows dynamically.
The user shall be prompted to enter a text string describing a string pattern.

At the main title screen, the user will be able to view a general help screen to reveal basic instructions on game play.
All users of the system shall login using some form of unique identification.

AgentMom shall support the ability to send unicast message.

the process by which the tool establishes the identity and privileges of the user by obtaining an identifier and password from the user and checking it against a database of predefined users.
The user must undo and redo its last thousand actions.
The product must count and display the number of the user's action.
The product must display a window with all the player's scores.
The system must allow a member of the network to send a bulk request on all or a large part of its driver’s smart card holders to a particular or all members of the network.
The system must provide automatic reply to the sender of the request through the use of a standard interface to the Members systems.
The system must track the workflow between senders and related replies.
The color translator allows old scheme to new scheme paint number translation, given a paint number, collection and a target collection.
The user color matcher only associates this information with a single client based on a persistent client session.
The color sample matcher will allow the user to graphically select with a hardware pointing device the color or blended color group they wish to use in a color search.
Scenario where the user wants to publish output data for the community, i.e. directly publish the data on dataportal.
Administrator has additional permissions to administer the operation of the system.

The system shall allow the user to select individual parameters as needed.
The system shall require the users enable cookies to use the system.
Auditor, Person appointed to manage County business by a majority vote of District Judges that have jurisdiction in the County.
Commissioners Court,The governing body of the County.
Detention Facility Officer, Person responsible for processing a Defendant into custody.

Local Selection Committee, Committee appointed by the Presiding Judge of the Administrative Judicial Region to adopt standards for the qualification of attorneys to be appointed to represent indigent defendants in capital cases in which the death penalty is sought.
Office of Attorney Appointments, Person responsible for managing the Indigent Defense appointment process.
Task Force on Indigent Defense, Standing committee of the Texas Judicial Council responsible for establishing standards for Indigent Defense Services.
With the use of an existing Passport account the user can login to the messenger.
The RLCS will provide access to system status data, to external systems through a firewall.

The system shall have a Graphical User Interface (GUI) that allows the operator to view system status, issue commands to change device status, configure the system, export log data, and generate reports.
When an operator is making changes on the system, the GUI configuration screen shall display to the user which device, controller, or workstation in the RLCS network will be affected by the changes.
The RLCS shall support remote system administration and maintenance of the system.
Each user will have different projects to work on as well as different access levels that will allow them certain privileges within the project.
The system will allow analysts and guest to choose a policy and a goal and then the system will allow analysts and guests to view the total occurrences of that particular goal in the chosen policy.
The system shall allow analysts to add a scenario to the system.
The system shall allow analysts to add new objects (names, types and other attributes).
The system shall allow analysts to graphically view the allowable flows for specific types within an organization and across multiple organizations given a set of access control policies.
The system shall generate an access log for every add, delete and edit action in the system.
The Clarus system shall be able to receive roadway weather measurements derived from VII data.
The Clarus system shall accept atmospheric condition data derived from atmospheric images.
The Clarus system shall accept environmental data from railroad vehicles.
The Clarus system shall allow human intervention to override automatically applied quality assessment.
The Clarus system shall record the methods applied when deriving quality control information.
The Clarus system shall enable system administrators to manage security groups.
The Clarus system shall acquire, process, and disseminate atmospheric metadata.
The Clarus system shall acquire, process, and disseminate hydrologic metadata.
The Clarus system shall be able to communicate with RWIS databases through their native interfaces.
The Clarus system shall enable environmental data queries by location reference.
The Clarus system shall enable environmental data queries by quality.
The Clarus system shall be able to operate on redundant hardware.
The Clarus system shall disseminate data using standard Internet protocols.
The Clarus system shall be able to receive all reported environmental data during a fifteen minute time interval.
The Clarus system shall be able to handle three hundred simultaneous requests for environmental element data.
The Clarus program shall define data quality assurance methods and criteria.
The product should allow multiple points to clicked so that multiple names can be displayed.
The product should allow the grid to be oriented by the user. Rotation, zoom and move functions should be employed.
If the patient is not cured then the doctor will refer the patient to some other Hospitals the hospital may be another VSP or any other.
The filed office will validate the claim form manually and through system,
The teachers and assistants shall only be allowed to enter or edit child comments and child arrival or departure times.
The administrators shall be allowed to enter or edit all data.
Systems supporting OM should be able to provide the aggregate data necessary for health event monitoring to systems that support response tracking
Systems supporting OM must be able to exchange aggregated data.
Systems supporting OM must be able to create and send messages for laboratory test requests.
Systems supporting OM must provide the ability to control the configuration of and revisions to investigation-specific questionnaires.
Systems supporting OM must provide the ability to publish investigationspecific questionnaires and implementation guides.
Systems supporting OM should provide a manual or automatic means of updating the status of case records as the case definition changes.
The user shall be able to view the data stored in the Physical Inventory tables through the Pontis graphical user interface (GUI).
The user shall be able to switch between predefined project lists.
The user shall be able to find projects by project ID, project name, project status, structure ID, and program.
The user shall be able to create a new inspection by copying a previous inspection.
The user shall be able to create new projects by manually entering the project information.
The user shall be able assign Pontis-generated work recommendations, inspector work candidates, and user-specified work items to a project, or remove work items from a project.
The administrator shall be able to assign users to application roles.
The user locates a solution to a problem with the help function.
The system has an embedded help file that contains basic solutions and hints for problematic situations
The Operational radio user shall be protected against all electrical hazards arising from the mobile equipment
System operator responsible for maintaining executable code, requiring full access to all aspects of the system.
The system shall allow user to select the product to configure.
The system shall display detailed product categorization to the user.

The system shall display the shipping charges.

The system shall allow user to select the order to be changed.
The system shall enable user to enter the payment information.

The system shall use secure sockets in all transactions that include any confidential customer information.
The system shall not leave any cookies on the customer’s computer containing the user’s password.
Broadcast voice calls provide one-way voice communications from a single user to multiple users in a pre-defined local area, all of whom are members of the same call group.
National values shall be applicable to a defined area.
The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect probe vehicle data from the car rental fleets using the car rental fleets’ interfaces.
The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect roadway traffic data from the Western Michigan Traffic Management System (WMTMS) using the WMTMS interface.
The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect roadway traffic data from NAVTEQ Corporation’s Traffic.com using the Traffic.com interface.
The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect traffic data from the Statewide TMC system using the Statewide TMC interface.
The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect road condition data from Traffic Management Systems (TMS) using the TMS interface.
The DUAP System shall be able to organize the sequence of execution of computational modules.
The DUAP Computational Services shall be able to derive speed from probe vehicle data.
The DUAP Output Services shall be able to publish traffic data in the SimTraffic traffic analysis tool SimTraffic interface format.
The DUAP System shall be capable of adding new output formats of published data.
The DUAP System shall be capable of adding new presentations of published data.
The System shall be capable of maintaining records of at least 30 days (configurable) worth of Ingest history.
The System shall be capable of rendering Mercator projections.
The System shall be capable of generating NOAA-Unique and Tailored Data Products with Government-specified grid spacing.
Accepts content from physical media (DVDs, external drives, etc.) or via electronic transfer (FTP) from producers.
Prompts a request for resubmission to the Content Originator if an error of transmission or receipt occurs
Transmission problems allow rejection of entire packages.
Maintains the integrity of the Data Management database which contains both metadata and system information.
The query request may require data to be sourced from different storage locations.
Allows query requests against all metadata used to manage the repository.
There may be a need to coordinate updates with metadata held in other systems.
Sends requests for system information to Data Management and receives reports.
Deletes AIPs from the repository. This may require the removal of the digital object’s files, and the retention of associated metadata, or the removal of both the files and metadata.
The system must be able to use search functionality as a way to navigate Moodle pages instead of using hierarchical links.
The system must allow actors in the capacity of course administrator to post grades associated with assignments for a particular actor in the capacity of student.
Course administrators can also track how they have changed a score over time using the timestamps associated with each change to the gradebook.
A system will be considered to meet this requirement if it has a single administrative interface rather than individual links for editing each page.
Furthermore, this interface must allow administrators to easily change themes and other setting that affect page layout across the entire courseware system.

Advanced end users: users that are familiar with programming and can personalize their database by creating auto-types, using command line options and generally can use features and maybe expand their use by adding more functions.
System administrators: administrators working on computers that support a lot of accounts and personal data for other users.
Mediator passes the service requirements to the PA.
Service Registry helps in discovering local resources through enabling the Web servers of CDN providers to register and publish their resource, service and policy details.
Policy Repository virtualizes all of the policies within a peering arrangement including PWS, PM, and PP, along with any delegated policies for resources as a result of the peering arrangement.
Web server: Publishes its resource and service information to the Service Registry.
Service Registry: Registers available local resources at the CDN provider and updates them.
The interaction protocol between Web Server - Service Registry, Service Registry - mediator is defined.
End users request for content from CDN Web server.
Web server sends initialization request to the mediator to trigger peering.
Mediator works in conjunction with the Peering Agent to establish negotiation.
Once policies are negotiated and a peering arrangement is established, Peering Agent interact each other in the execution of common goal(s).
Primary CDN has already acquired sufficient external resources.
